images.caption:
# **Approaching a Lift**

A common workplace injury is to the back, caused by incorrect lifting or handling of heavy or large objects. 

Often, the injury won’t be felt for some time and may be permanent.

Swipe to review each of the seven steps to safe lifting.

## Step 1 – Plan for the lift. 
Consider the task duration, the layout of the work environment and experience of lift participants. Make sure your route is clear.

## Step 2 – Get in position.
Stand close to the load with yout feet apart creating a stable base for lifting.

## Step 3 – Begin lift
Bend at the knees and keep your back straight.

## Step 4 – Pick up the object
Get a firm grip and move the object close to the body.

## Step 5 - Lift
Always lift smoothly (do not jerk). Where possible exert force in a forward or backward motion, as movements such as twisting, bending and overreaching will increase the risk of injury.

## Step 6 – Manoeuvre the object
Always keep arms and load close to your body when turning.

## Step 7 – Lower the object
Use the leg muscles to lower the load. Keep your back as straight as possible.

answer.text:
It is important to give full consideration to the following areas when planning a lift;
- Where and how equipment is laid out.
- The location where the object is to be set down.
- The size and weight of the object.

answers.content: Where and how equipment is laid out which could block your route.
The size and weight of the object which is to be lifted.
The location where the object is to be set down.

data.title: What do you need to know when planning a lift?

question.content: What do you need to know when planning a lift?

answers.content: Where and how equipment is laid out which could block your route.
The size and weight of the object which is to be lifted.
The location where the object is to be set down.

answer.text:
Objects need to be carefully assessed on an individual basis as to whether they can be lifted safely. Test the load prior to attempting a lift and make sure you know how heavy it is.

**Do not** attempt a lift unless you are sure if it is safe to proceed.

data.buttonText: When planning a lift you only need to have a guess at an object's weight before performing the lift.

answer.text: When carrying out a team lift, ensure that only **one** person is giving out instructions.
